word_mean: 粘连，粘着物：保持密切接近的特性，如由于物质对分子的物理吸引或物体接触面间的分子吸引
几部分相互间稳固的接合(可能是不正常的)
把各部分异常地粘连在一起的纤维带或纤维组织
黏附是一种非特异性细胞信号转导的重要方式
涂层与基底间联结力的总称。

sentence.Network_en: Better driv-ing equipment will improve track adhesion in slippery conditions.
sentence.Network_cn: 较好的驾驶设备能够提升在湿滑路面上的抓地力。

sentence.Network_en: Fig . 8 . 15 shows some experimental results for limiting adhesion against creep.
sentence.Network_cn: 图8.15表示试验得出的极限粘着力对爬动量的关系.

sentence.Network_en: Direct proof of the mechanism of adhesion is quite elusive.
sentence.Network_cn: 直接证明粘结的机理是十分困难的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from French adhésion, from Latin adhaesio(n-), from the verb adhaerere (see adhere)

entry.def: Adhesion is the ability of one thing to stick firmly to another.

example.ex: Better driving equipment will improve track adhesion in slippery conditions.
example.tran: 较好的驾驶设备能够提升在湿滑路面上的抓地力。

means.word_mean: 1. abnormal union of bodily tissues; most common in the abdomen
2. a fibrous band of scar tissue that binds together normally separate anatomical structures
3. the property of sticking together (as of glue and wood) or the joining of surfaces of different composition
4. faithful support for a religion or cause or political party

stems_affixes.value_cn: 粘性物质[如粘胶],带粘性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ad增加+hes粘附+ive……的→adj.&n.粘性物质[如粘胶],带粘性的
